snippet: Negotiators will discuss decades-old property claims from thousands of American citizens and companies whose assets were confiscated after Cuba’s revolution.
abstract: Cuban and American representatives are expected to meet and for first time discuss and try to settle American property claims from time of Cuban revolution; Cuban government seized $1.9 billion in personal and corporate property after US trade embargo was established and elimination of same embargo will likely be part of any settlement agreement.
lead_paragraph: Negotiators will discuss decades-old property claims from thousands of American citizens and companies whose assets were confiscated after Cuba’s revolution.

headline.main: Cuba and U.S. to Discuss Settling Claims on Property
headline.print_headline: Cuba and U.S. Set to Discuss Settling Claims on Property
